intro: Centella repanda var. floridana, commonly known as the Florida centella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
